Page.title: about
Page._content:
-  Hi, Im @RanFang66
-  I graduated from Harbin Institude of Technology with a master degree  of electrical engineering
-  Im interested in embeded software development, Linux, raspberry PI, OpenCV, QT
-  Im currently learning QT, OpenCV and Japanese
-  You can reach me through ranfang66@gmail.com

Post.title: Hello World
Post._content:
Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

Welcome to [Hexo](https://hexo.io/)! This is your very first post. Check [documentation](https://hexo.io/docs/) for more info. If you get any problems when using Hexo, you can find the answer in [troubleshooting](https://hexo.io/docs/troubleshooting.html) or you can ask me on [GitHub](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/issues).

## Quick Start

### Create a new post

``` bash
$ hexo new "My New Post"
```

More info: [Writing](https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html)

### Run server

``` bash
$ hexo server
```

More info: [Server](https://hexo.io/docs/server.html)

### Generate static files

``` bash
$ hexo generate
```

More info: [Generating](https://hexo.io/docs/generating.html)

### Deploy to remote sites

``` bash
$ hexo deploy
```

More info: [Deployment](https://hexo.io/docs/one-command-deployment.html)

Post.title: Makefile Learning Notes
Post._content:
## 

Makefile 

```makefile
targets : prerequisites
	command
```

- targets: .o
- prerequisites: 
- command: makeshell

<!--more-->

Makefile

1. 
2. make
3. Makefileshell
4. makefilemakefilecincludemakefilec
5. shell#

make

shellmakeMakefile



1. 
2. 
3. 

## Makefile 

Makefile shell

|  |                    |
| ------ | ---------------------- |
| *      | 0  |
| ?      |        |
| []     |  |



``` makefile
obj = *.c
test : $(obj)
	gcc -o $@ $^
```

make*.cwildcard

``` makefile
obj = $(wildcard *.c)
test : $(obj)
	gcc -o $@ $^
```

Makefile  % 

``` makefile
test : test1.o test2.o
	gcc -o $@ $^
%.o : %.c
	gcc -o $@ $^
```

%.o.o%.cMakefile

## Makefile

### 

` = `

0

``` makefile
OBJ = a.o b.o c.o
test : $(OBJ)
	gcc -o test $(OBJ)
```

### 

- (:=)   
- (=)    
- (?=)   
- (+=)   

``` makefile
x = abc
y = $(x)d
x := efg	#  x=efg, y=abcd
x = efg		#  x=efg, y=efgd
x ?= efg	#  x=abc, y=abcd
x += efg	#  x=abc efg, y=abcd

```

### 

|  |                                                          |
| :--------: | ------------------------------------------------------------ |
|     $@     | Linux  .a   |
|     $%     |        |
|     $<     |  |
|     $?     | .o  |
|     $^     | .o  $^  |
|     $+     | $^ |
|     $*     | %  |

## Makefile 

Makefile`VPATH` `vpath`.

VPATHvpathVPATHvpath

### VPATH

MakefileVPATH

``` makefile
VPATH := src
```



``` makefile
VPAHT := path1:path2
```

 ### vpath

vpath

```makefile
1. vpath PATTERN DIRECTORIES
2. vpath PATTERN
3. vpath
```

 3 vpath

### 

srcmain.c, module1.c, module2.cincmodule1.h, module2.h

``` makefile
vpath %.c 	src
vpath %.h	inc		##  VPATH = src inc
main : main.o module1.o module2.o
	gcc -o $@ $<
main.o : main.c
	gcc -o $@ $^
module1.o : module1.c module1.h
	gcc -o $@ $<
module2.o : module2.c module2.h
	gcc -o $@ $<
```

## Makefile 



## Makefile 

MakefileMakefile

|  |              |      |
| ------ | ---------------- | ---- |
| ifeq   |  |      |
| ifneq  |  |      |
| ifdef  |      |      |
| ifndef |    |      |

### ifeq  ifneq



``` makefile
ifeq (ARG1, arg2)
# ifeq "ARG1" "ARG2"
# ifeq 'ARG1' 'ARG2'
	xxx
else
	xxx
endif
```



``` makefile
gcc_libs = -lgnu
default_libs = 
ifeq ($(CC), gcc)
	libs = $(gcc_libs)
else
	libs = $(default_libs)
endif
foo : $(objects)
	$(CC) -o foo $(objects) $(libs)
```

### ifdef  ifndef



``` makefile
ifdef VARIABLE_NAME
```

## Makefile 



1. Makefile
2. make

3. clean

``` makefile
.PHONY : clean
clean :
	rm -rf *.o $(PROGRAM)
```

2. make 

``` makefile
SUBDIRS = foo bar baz
.PHONY : subdirs $(SUBDIRS)
subdirs : $(SUBDIRS)
$(SUBDIRS) : 
	$(MAKE) -C $@
foo: baz
```

			make

3. 

   Makefile

   ``` makefile
   .PHONY all
   all : test1 test2 test3
   test1 : test1.o
   	gcc -o $@ $^
   test2 : test2.o
   	gcc -o $@ $^
   test3 : test3.o
   	gcc -o $@ $^
   ```

   alltest1, test2, test3

## Makefile

Makefile

`$(<function> <arguments>)`  `${<function> <arguments>}` 

functionarguments

### 



```makefile
$(patsubst <pattern>, <replacement>, <text>)
```

textpatternreplacement



```makefile
C_SOURCE = $(shell find . -name *.c)
C_OBJECTS=$(patsubst %.c, %.o, $(C_SOURCE))
main : $(C_OBJECTS)
	gcc -o $@ $^
$(C_OBJECTS) : $(C_SOURCE)
```

### 

``` makefile
$(subst <from>, <to>, <text>)
```

textfromto



``` makefile
OBJ = $(subst Beijing, Shanghai, I love Beijing)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	#  I love Shanghai
```

### 

```makefile
$(strip <string>)
```

string

### 

```makefile
$(findstring <find>, <in>)
```

infind



```makefile
OBJ = $(findstring you, I hate you)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	#  you
```

### 

``` makefile
$(filter <pattern>, <text>)
```

textpatternpatternpattern



``` makefile
OBJ = $(filter %.c %.o, foo1.c foo2.o foo3.s)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	#foo1.c foo2.o
```

### 

``` makefile
$(filter-out <pattern>, <text>)
```

filterpatternpattern

``` makefile
OBJ = $(filter-out %.c %.o, foo1.c foo2.o foo3.s)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	#foo3.s
```

### 

``` makefile
$(sort <list>)
```

list



``` makefile
OBJ = $(sort orange apple pear apple)
all: 
	@echo $(OBJ) #  apple orange pear
```

**notice** : sort

### 

``` makefile
$(word <n>, <text>)
```

textnn



```makefile
OBJ = $(word 2, foo1.c foo2.c foo3.c)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	#  foo2.c
```

## Makefile 

### 

``` makefile
$(dir <names>)
```

names./

### 

``` makefile
$(notdir <names>)
```

names

### 

``` makefile
$(suffix <names>)
```

names

### 

``` makefile
$(basename <names>)
```

names

### 

``` makefile
$(addsuffix <suffix>, <names>)
```

suffixnames

### 

```makefile
$(addprefix <prefix>, <names>)
```

prefixnames

### 

```makefile
$(join <list1>, <list2>)
```

list2list1list1list2list1list1list2list2

### 

```makefile
$(wildcard PATTERN)
```

PATTERNPATTERN

### Exam

```makefile
OBJ = $(dir src/main.c src/module1.c inc/module1.h bsp.h)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	# src/ src/ inc/ ./
	
OBJ = $(notdir src/main.c src/module1.c inc/module1.h bsp.h)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	#main.c module1.c module1.h bsp.h
	
OBJ = $(suffix src/main.c src/module1.c inc/module1.h bsp.h)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	#.c .c .h .h
	
OBJ = $(basename src/main.c src/module1.c inc/module1.h bsp.h)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	# src/main src/module1 inc/module1 bsp

OBJ = $(addsuffix .c, src/main src/module1)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	# src/main.c src/module1.c
	
OBJ = $(addprefix src/, main.c module1.c)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	# src/main.c src/module1.c
	
OBJ = $(join main module1 module2, .c .h)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)	# main.c module1.h module2
	
OBJ = $(wildcard *.c *.h)
main : $(OBJ)
	gcc -o $@ $^
	
```

## Makefile

### 

``` makefile
$(foreach <var>, <list>, <text>)
```

listvartext

**Notice** foreachvar

```makefile
name = main module1 module2
files = $(foreach n, $(name), $(n).o)
all:
	@echo $(files)  # main.o module1.o module2.o
```

### 

```makefile
$(if <condition>, <then-part>)
$(if <condition>, <then-part>, <else-part>)
```

conditionthen-partelse-partconditionelse-partconditioncondition

```makefile
OBJ = foo.c
OBJ = $(if $(OBJ), $(OBJ), main.c)
all:
	@echo $(OBJ)		# foo.c
```

### 

```makefile
$(call <expression>, <parm1>, <parm2>, <parm3>, ...)
```

expressioncallexpression$(1)\$(2)\$(3)parm1 parm2, parm3expression

``` makefile
files = $(2).c $(1).c
obj = $(call files, main, module)
all:
	@echo $(obj)	# module.c main.c
```

### 

```makefile
$(origin <variable>)
```

origin variablevariable$origin

|        |                                                  |
| ------------ | ---------------------------------------------------- |
| undefined    | variable                                 |
| default      | variableCC                       |
| environment  | variablemakefile-e |
| file         | variableMakefile                     |
| command line | variable                       |
| override     | variableoverride                 |
| automatic    | variable                   |

## Makefile

 MakefileincludemakeincludeMakefileincludeMakefile

```makefile
include <filenames>
-include <filenames>
```



-  `include <filenames>` make make 
-  `-include <filenames>`make 

**Notice** :include Makefile  Makefile 

### Makefile

```makefile
subsystem:
	cd subdir && $(MAKE)
```

makesubdirMakefilesubdirmakemakemakeMakefileMakefile



```makefile
subsystem:
	$(MAKE) -C subdir
```

makeCURDIRmake-C

### Make

make

```makefile
export <variable>
```

export

SHELLMAKEFLAGSexportMakefile
